data: Self-consistent construction of virialized wave dark matter halos

Wave dark matter (ψ DM), which satisfies the Schrödinger-Poisson equation, has recently attracted substantial attention as a possible dark matter candidate. Numerical simulations have, in the past, provided a powerful tool to explore this new territory of possibility. Despite their successes in revealing several key features of ψ DM, further progress in simulations is limited, in that cosmological simulations so far can only address formation of halos below∼ 2× 10 11 M⊙ and substantially more massive halos have become computationally very challenging to obtain. For this reason, the present work adopts a different approach in assessing massive halos by constructing wave-halo solutions directly from the wave distribution function.
